title: What’s behind the rise of teeny weeny beanies?
description: Micro hats, with their military and marine roots, can now be seen on everyone from football pundit Ian Wright to Tyler, the Creator. But do they keep you warm?• Don’t get Fashion Statement delivered to your inbox? Sign up hereAs an arctic blast hit the UK this week, most of us turned to our trusty puffer jackets and woolly hats. Others dug out something a little more surprising from their accessories arsenal: a micro beanie.Worn high across the forehead, these bijou beanies are purposely rolled up by wearers, leaving their ears exposed to the elements. With roots in maritime and military settings – they were originally rolled up to avoid any obstruction to hearing – they are sometimes called fisherman or watch caps. But rather than being worn on the high seas, they are now sported by creative types in offices and coffee shops from London to Lancaster. Continue reading...
author: Chloe Mac Donnell

title: ‘Stone Island is a religion’: fashion chief Carlo Rivetti on football’s famous brand and dressing Eric Cantona
description: ‘Stoney’ has been worn by everyone from Drake to Keir Starmer, but its position as label of choice on the terraces gets the highest attention score. We talk to its chair and former ownerIn a quiet corner of Stone Island’s flagship London store in Soho, the brand’s Italian chair, Carlo Rivetti, is talking about darts. “You see these big fat guys,” says Rivetti, who is sporting whiskers that make him look more like a trawlerman than a fashion magnate. “Pom … pom … pom,” he adds, imitating the noise a dart makes when it hits the board.Darts is possibly the one British subculture that Rivetti’s brand hasn’t touched: football casuals, rappers, politicians, musicians and athletes have all reached for “Stoney” as it is known in the UK, as a sign of masculine cool. Darts might just be the final frontier. Continue reading...

author: Billy Webb

title: 5 Holiday Party Outfit Ideas Using Clothes You Probably Already Own
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. If we had a dollar for every time we’ve seen sequins, velvet, or tassels in the last month, we’d be rich enough to buy every party outfit we ever wanted. Alas… Now that holiday invites are coming in thick and fast, we’re auditing our wardrobes (and wallets) for party-appropriate looks. Some of us will jump glitter-jeans-first into maximalist revelries, there are others who prefer less pomp and circumstance, and will seek quiet ways to celebrate the season in style. Just as no two parties are the same, there isn’t just one festive outfit formula” Whether you prefer a wide-leg pant over a swishy skirt or cozy sweaters over breezy halter tops, rest assured that no one’s expecting you to wear anything you don’t want to. Consider this your sign to push aside all your presumptions about holiday style and wear what truly makes you feel in the spirit of the season. Dress up the clothes you already have in your wardrobe, swap them out with friends, or invest in new pieces that you know you’ll wear again and again. Below, discover five alternative holiday party outfit ideas to try this year. Alternative Holiday Party Outfit: Floral Print While we tend to rule out floral prints for winter, we could all use a bit of sunshine during this long, dark season. Trade in your go-to sequins for a more versatile floral shirt and matching trousers, or a printed dress with tights and boots. FYI: A larger-scale graphic will look more wintry (and more formal) than a dainty one. Alternative Holiday Party Outfit: Burgundy Instead Of Red Burgundy is great when you want to dress on theme but can’t get on board with Santa Claus red. The dark red hue is much easier to style, even acting as a neutral. Opt for a one-and-done co-ord, and you’ll be sure to wear it long after the festive season is over. Alternative Holiday Party Outfit: Utilitarian Pairings Yes, your more utilitarian-feeling pieces can be dressed up for the holidays, too. Add a formal accent, like a cinched blazer and skinny heeled boots, to your camo cargo pants. The result is a smartly constructed, comfortable look that’s suitable for an after-work office party or dinner with friends. Alternative Holiday Party Outfit: Dressed-Up Track Pants If the occasion allows for it, glam-ify your coziest track pants for the ultimate cool-girl vibe. Style with an off-the-shoulder knit, slinky bodysuit, or sheer mini dress. The party power here is in your accessories: Stack on loads of jewelry, and pair with statement shoes or a sleek handbag. Alternative Holiday Party Outfit: Boxy Silhouettes Often the best thing about a holiday party is the food. Factor this into your clothing choices with boxy silhouettes, such as oversized jackets and tees, button-down shirts, and wide-leg trousers. When in doubt, throw on a pair of sparkly heels. Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?7 Holiday Dressing Trends For The MinimalistsHow To Wear Ruffles — The Latest Holiday Trend10 Party Dress & Shoes Combos To Inspire All Your
author: Ebony-Renee Baker

title: What To Buy From The Ssense Sale, Every Fashion Person’s Favorite Shopping Destination
description: The Ssense sale is every fashion person's favorite corner of the internet. It's where you'll uncover truly special pieces from powerhouse designer brands (Acne Studios, Dries Van Noten, Loewe, Maison Margiela, Valentino), industry darlings (16Arlington, Cecilie Bahnsen, Molly Goddard, Simone Rocha, Undercover), and buzzy up-and-comers (Conner Ives, Diotima, Hodakova, Paolina Russo, Shushu/Tong) — all at discounts deeper than you'd find elsewhere. Right now, the retailer's winter shopping event is in full swing, where Fall/Winter 2024 collections are up to 50% off. Translation: you can snag a runway look for half the price and score a new forever piece — think tall riding boots, long camel coats, olive-green quilted jackets, black leather shoulder bags, and other staples you’ll reach for on repeat.But part of the thrill of the Ssense sale is the treasure hunt itself: nearly 500 pages of products to sift through in search of fashion gold. We’ve done the digging for you, curating the 24 discounted designer finds worth adding to your cart right now. Enjoy! At Refinery29, we’re here to help you navigate this overwhelming world of stuff. All of our market picks are independently selected and curated by the editorial team. If you buy something we link to on our site, Refinery29 may earn commission.Turtlenecks are to winter what white T-shirts are to summer: the you-don't-even-have-to-think-about-it top you can’t stop wearing. Liven up your rotation with a printed one, like this option from Ganni. Layer it under a black, gray, or camel crewneck sweater to let the green-and-blue graphic peek through for an unexpected contrast.Shop Ssense.Ganni Long Sleeve Turtleneck, $, available at SSENSEMuch ink has been spilled about the glory that is Skims' lounge dress — you can see what all the fuss is about, now that a few different silhouettes are on sale at Ssense. We're partial to the long-sleeved turtleneck maxi for cold-weather layering. Shop Ssense.Skims Soft Lounge Turtleneck Maxi Dress, $, available at SSENSEIf we're following runway rules, boots are getting taller and taller. Calf- to knee-high shapes are favored by designers in their fall collections, and these creamy-white leather ones from Jil Sander are a solid investment. A classic shape with a flat, commuter-friendly sole.Shop Ssense.Jil Sander Riding Tall Boots, $, available at SSENSEThis nylon quilted jacket from Mackage has a lot to offer, but its biggest draw might just be its packable design, making it a solid travel piece.Shop Ssense. Mackage Down Packable Etoile Jacket, $, available at SSENSEA little Molly Goddard frill! (Get it?) Shop Ssense.Molly Goddard Olive Midi Skirt, $, available at SSENSEMelissa and Undercover’s collab brings us rubberized loafers that bring jelly shoes into the cooler months. (Wouldn’t they look amazing paired with a printed sock?)Shop Ssense.Undercover x Melissa Royal High Loafers, $, available at SSENSEConsider this your favorite pair of jeans' new BFF.Shop Ssense.Chopova Lowena Elaine Long Sleeve T-Shirt, $, available at SSENSERemember those spiky rubber earrings from Claire’s? These are like their grown-up cousin: more subtle, just as fun.Shop Ssense.Justine Clenquet Hirschy Earrings, $, available at SSENSEA slightly oversized, rib-knit turtleneck is infinitely versatile — as good with jeans, layered over a lacy slip, or styled with a tweed mini skirt.Shop Ssense.Isabel Marant Iris Sweater, $, available at SSENSEBelt bags are no longer just a fancy way to say waist bags. Designers are adding buckles and belt-like elements to handbags, and the result? Quite fun. This Moschino one is a solid contender for “aspirational everyday bag.”Shop Ssense.Moschino Tie Me Bucket Bag, $, available at SSENSECecilie Bahnsen's ethereal, feminine dresses get a lot of attention (rightfully so — they're stunning), but don't sleep on the Danish brand's separates. This T-shirt boasts the label's signature shirring and ruffles, in a more... let's say demure package.Shop Ssense.Cecile Bahnsen Vilde T-shirt, $, available at SSENSELounge pants chic enough to wear outside the house? We didn't need that much convincing — Ssense had us at "rib-knit Proenza Schouler bottoms at 70% off."Shop Ssense.Proenza Schouler Cotton Lounge Pants, $, available at SSENSEAttico's riff on the ballerina flat boasts grid-like cutouts and mirror appliqués — very much primed for lighting up the dance floor on New Year's Eve.Shop Ssense.The Attico Grid Ballerina Flats, $, available at SSENSEThom Browne makes a strong case for uniform dressing, and this tartan tweed skirt is straight out of a dark-academia sartorial fantasy.Shop Ssense.Thom Browne Tartan Midi Skirt, $, available at SSENSEBehold: a not-ugly sweater that works for every holiday festivity.Shop Ssense.Paco Rabanne Jacquard Knit Capsule Sweater, $, available at SSENSEA street-style favorite, this metallic patent-leather 1DR bag pairs perfectly with all of your planned holiday party looks, and will carry you into the new year with ease.Shop Ssense.Diesel 1DR Bag, $, available at SSENSEThis checked puffer from Kenzo has a delightful surprise: a stow-away hood hidden in the collar for extra coverage when you need it.Shop Ssense.Kenzo Check Down Puffer Jacket, $, available at SSENSEZhuzh up your everyday low bun with a fun scrunchie. Shop Ssense.Maryam Nassir Zadeh Carnation Scrunchie, $, available at SSENSESave this dress for a spring or summer wedding guest outfit — or wear it to a holiday function layered over a slim-fitting turtleneck with sparkly heels.Shop SsenseSimone Rocha Pressed Rose Midi Dress, $, available at SSENSEWhen was the last time you upgraded your leather ankle boots? If you need a sign, here it is: How does 70% off sound?Shop Ssense.Comme Se-A Ronda Boots, $, available at SSENSEThis Lauren Manoogian double-fact coat, with its dropped shoulders and shawl color, just looks so luxurious.Shop Ssense.Lauren Manoogian Double Face Coat, $, available at SSENSETotême’s mastery of modernizing wardrobe staples — beloved among editors and influencers — is unmatched. This blazer, with its off-center buttons and asymmetric cut, is a perfect example.Shop Ssense. Toteme Off-Center Wrap Blazer, $, available at SSENSEThese knee-high slip-on boots in a not-so-mellow yellow will brighten up even the gloomiest winter days (and wardrobes).Shop Ssense. By Far Russel Boots, $, available at SSENSEThe (detachable) faux fur collar adds a touch of whimsy to this otherwise utilitarian down jacket by Nanushka.Shop Ssense.Nanushka Zacharie Down Jacket, $, available at SSENSELike what you see? author: Ana Colon

title: The Best Early Black Friday Fashion Deals - According to a Shopping Expert
description: Is there anything better than finding (read: falling in love with) a new handbag or trendy pair of sneakers, then discovering that the same product is also on sale at a fraction of its usual cost? Even after years of working as a shopping editor, I know firsthand that the "stars aligned" feeling of finding a dream style at the right price never really goes away - especially come Black Friday, when the season's most coveted wardrobe essentials are often marked down at their lowest prices of the year. While we're still a little over a week out from 2024's biggest shopping day, many retailers are getting in the holiday spirit early, with Black Friday sales that span the entire month of November and encompass a range of products. J.Crew is offering up to 50 percent off styles sitewide, including cozy sweaters and cardigans. Forever 21's early Black Friday sale is live, where shoppers can take 30 percent off trendy fashion staples - like faux-leather coats and evening bags. And even Amazon unveiled a bevy of new fashion markdowns on its bestselling clothing - including editor-loved bodysuits and Levi's jeans. Regardless of what you're in the market for, you can save big on it right now. Keep reading to shop our picks for the best early Black Friday fashion deals. Looking for something specific? Jump to our specific categories below: Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Bestsellers Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Tops and Sweaters Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Bottoms Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Dresses Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Winter Jackets Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Shoes Early Black Friday Fashion Deals on Accessories Update on November 21, 2024 at 11:30 a.m.: Updated prices and checked stock for all products. Looking for even more sales? Shop more of PS's Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals, and subscribe to our newsletter for more shopping recommendations.
author: Kyley Warren

title: 12 Abercrombie Jeans TikTok Is Obsessed With Right Now
description: You can never have enough pairs of comfortable and stylish jeans, and as shopping editors, we're always on the hunt for the best ones. TikTok has been obsessed with Abercrombie's assortment of jeans for quite some time. In fact, the brand gained a whole new crop of fans and admirers after they spotted the brand's Curve Love straight jeans on Francia Raísa's character in "How I Met Your Father." Even our editors are fans of the brand's wardrobe essentials and the new NFL collection, both of which pair beautifully with the brand's denim lineup. If you want to try these fan-favorite jeans for yourself, we curated some of the top styles you need in your closet. Standout denim styles include the editor-backed '90s straight jeans and mom jeans. The Curve Love collection is also on sale and it has an additional two inches at the hips and thighs, giving you a comfortable yet figure-flattering look that hugs your curves in all the right places. Each pair comes in a variety of washes and designs, too. Whether you're in the market for a crisscross waistband or a distressed look, the list ahead includes all the latest denim trends. These styles also accommodate height with length options ranging from extra short to long. Ahead, you can shop our favorite denim shorts and timeless jeans from Abercrombie. Some washes and styles are on sale too, so stock up while you can!
author: Anvita Reddy
